intro: Spergula gamostyla, commonly known as the common spikegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often found in meadows and along stream banks. The plant has slender, tufted shoots with narrow, grass-like leaves, and its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet at the tip of each stem. Spergula gamostyla produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are wind-pollinated, and it is known for its ability to thrive in temperate climates. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
